ai-mil5.5.3:1.1_0: “Venerable Sir, the Buddha has said these words:
ai-mil5.5.3:1.2_0: ‘I, Mendicants, am a brahmin, committed to charity, always open-handed, bearing my final body.’
ai-mil5.5.3:1.4_0: ‘The foremost of my monk disciples in unrestrained is Bakkula.’
ai-mil5.5.3:1.5_0: and the Buddha’s relics will be great.
ai-mil5.5.3:1.6_0: The Realized One has an unsurpassed elephant. ...
ai-mil5.5.3:1.8_0: If the senior monks were afflicted with any of these diseases, they think: ‘I am ill indeed.’ ...
ai-mil5.5.3:1.9_0: is a dart, a dart, aroused, and wrong.
ai-mil5.5.3:1.10_0: this question too should be expelled by a each question.”
ai-mil5.5.3:2.1_0: “Great king, the Buddha has spoken about this:
ai-mil5.5.3:2.3_0: ‘They’re arrow, and he speaks a message.’
ai-mil5.5.3:2.5_0: But the outlet of the household life is referring to the end of themselves, being referring to their own treasures.
ai-mil5.5.3:3.1_0: There are, great king, his disciples who are walking-path in a place that they walked back and forth on the day of the night. When they was walking mindfully in that place, they sat on the day, lying down on the ground.
ai-mil5.5.3:4.1_0: There are, great king, some disciples who eat only alms-food over the Buddha, and even a second time. The Buddha eats only what was given, not even a second time. What is said to be the third occasion, great king, not even a single one of these most food.
ai-mil5.5.3:4.2_0: And the Buddha is the supreme freedom through ethics, immersion, wisdom, and knowledge and vision of freedom.
ai-mil5.5.3:5.1_0: It’s when a person is one-proceed in birth, one is calm, one who spends the bow and quietly, and one who is attached to them all. All these kings are supreme.
ai-mil5.5.3:5.2_0: In the same way, the Buddha is the best of all beings.
ai-mil5.5.3:6.1_0: And when Venerable Bakkula was sick, he became one of the gods. He brought it up with a hundred carbunctions,
ai-mil5.5.3:7.1_0: “And great king, when the Buddha was sick, that is how all the arrivals does not arise in the beginning, “Now there is no ascetic practice,” and so on.
ai-mil5.5.3:7.2_0: The Buddha has spoken about the gods of the Thirty-Three:
ai-mil5.5.3:8.1_0: ‘Mendicants, the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, is said to be the best of all sentient beings—be they footless, with two feet, four feet, or many feet; with form or formless; with perception or without perception or with neither perception nor non-perception.’”
ai-mil5.5.3:9.1_0: “Good, sir, would you agree with such a dragon?”
